eapli.framework.domain.ddd

Interface Repository<T extends AggregateRoot<?>,I extends Serializable>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the entity
    I - the type of the entity's identity
    All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DeleteableRepository<T,I>

    public interface Repository<T extends AggregateRoot<?>,I extends Serializable>
extends Iterable<T>
    A repository is a domain-driven design pattern to abstract the details of persisting domain objects. it exposes a pure domain based interface without leaking details of the implementation of the actual persistence mechanism. there should be one repository per aggregate root
    Author:
    Paulo Gandra Sousa

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(T entity)
      adds a new entity to the repository. if the entity already exists it will throw an exception. formally, the exception will be throw if there is already an entity with the same business identity.
      boolean contains(I identity)
      checks for the existence of an entity with the provided ID.
      boolean contains(T entity)
      checks for the existence of an entity with the provided ID.
      Iterable<T> first(int n)
      returns the first n entities according to its "natural" order
      Iterable<T> page(int pageNumber, int pageSize)
      returns a page of results using the natural order of the collection
      Optional<T> read(I identity)
      reads an entity given its ID
      T save(T entity)
      inserts or updates an entity
      long size()
      returns the number of entities in the repository.
      T update(T entity)
      updates an existing entity in the repository

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Iterable

        forEach, iterator, spliterator

      • add

        boolean add(T entity)
     throws DataIntegrityViolationException
        adds a new entity to the repository. if the entity already exists it will throw an exception. formally, the exception will be throw if there is already an entity with the same business identity. i.e., Any x such that x.equals(e) is true FIXME check which exception to throw. it should not be a persistence layer exception.
        Parameters:
        entity -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        DataIntegrityViolationException
